lines.text: Enter Provost and POMPEY

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Come hither, sirrah. Can you cut off a mans head

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: If the man be a bachelor, sir, I can but if he be a married man, hes his wifes head, and I can never cut off a womans head.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Come, sir, leave me your snatches, and yield me a direct answer. Tomorrow morning are to die Claudio and Barnardine. Here is in our prison a common executioner, who in his office lacks a helper: if you will take it on you to assist him, it shall redeem you from your gyves if not, you shall have your full time of imprisonment and your deliverance with an unpitied whipping, for you have been a notorious bawd.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, I have been an unlawful bawd time out of mind but yet I will be content to be a lawful hangman. I would be glad to receive some instruction from my fellow partner.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: What, ho! Abhorson! Wheres Abhorson, there
Enter ABHORSON

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: Do you call, sir

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Sirrah, heres a fellow will help you tomorrow in your execution. If you think it meet, compound with him by the year, and let him abide here with you if not, use him for the present and dismiss him. He cannot plead his estimation with you he hath been a bawd.

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: A bawd, sir fie upon him! he will discredit our mystery.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Go to, sir you weigh equally a feather will turn the scale.
Exit

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Pray, sir, by your good favour,for surely, sir, a good favour you have, but that you have a hanging look,do you call, sir, your occupation a mystery

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: Ay, sir a mystery

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Painting, sir, I have heard say, is a mystery and your whores, sir, being members of my occupation, using painting, do prove my occupation a mystery: but what mystery there should be in hanging, if I should be hanged, I cannot imagine.

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: Sir, it is a mystery.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Proof

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: Every true mans apparel fits your thief: if it be too little for your thief, your true man thinks it big enough if it be too big for your thief, your thief thinks it little enough: so every true mans apparel fits your thief.
Reenter Provost

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Are you agreed

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sir, I will serve him for I do find your hangman is a more penitent trade than your bawd he doth oftener ask forgiveness.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: You, sirrah, provide your block and your axe tomorrow four oclock.

lines.speaker: abhorson
lines.text: Come on, bawd I will instruct thee in my trade follow.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: I do desire to learn, sir: and I hope, if you have occasion to use me for your own turn, you shall find me yare for truly, sir, for your kindness I owe you a good turn.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Call hither Barnardine and Claudio: The one has my pity not a jot the other, Being a murderer, though he were my brother. Look, heres the warrant, Claudio, for thy death: Tis now dead midnight, and by eight tomorrow Thou must be made immortal. Wheres Barnardine
Exeunt POMPEY and ABHORSON
Enter CLAUDIO

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: As fast lockd up in sleep as guiltless labour When it lies starkly in the travellers bones: He will not wake.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Who can do good on him Well, go, prepare yourself. But, hark, what noise Heaven give your spirits comfort! By and by. I hope it is some pardon or reprieve For the most gentle Claudio. Welcome father.
Knocking within
Exit CLAUDIO
Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: The best and wholesomest spirts of the night Envelope you, good Provost! Who calld here of late

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: None, since the curfew rung.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Not Isabel

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: They will, then, eret be long.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: What comfort is for Claudio

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Theres some in hope.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: It is a bitter deputy.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Not so, not so his life is paralleld Even with the stroke and line of his great justice: He doth with holy abstinence subdue That in himself which he spurs on his power To qualify in others: were he meald with that Which he corrects, then were he tyrannous But this being so, hes just. Now are they come. This is a gentle provost: seldom when The steeled gaoler is the friend of men. How now! what noise That spirits possessed with haste That wounds the unsisting postern with these strokes.
Knocking within
Exit Provost
Knocking within
Reenter Provost

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: There he must stay until the officer Arise to let him in: he is calld up.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Have you no countermand for Claudio yet, But he must die tomorrow

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: None, sir, none.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: As near the dawning, provost, as it is, You shall hear more ere morning.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Happily You something know yet I believe there comes No countermand no such example have we: Besides, upon the very siege of justice Lord Angelo hath to the public ear Professd the contrary. This is his lordships man.
Enter a Messenger

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: And here comes Claudios pardon.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: [Giving a paper] My lord hath sent you this note and by me this further charge, that you swerve not from the smallest article of it, neither in time, matter, or other circumstance. Good morrow for, as I take it, it is almost day.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I shall obey him.
Exit Messenger

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: [Aside]  This is his pardon, purchased by such sin For which the pardoner himself is in. Hence hath offence his quick celerity, When it is born in high authority: When vice makes mercy, mercys so extended, That for the faults love is the offender friended. Now, sir, what news

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I told you. Lord Angelo, belike thinking me remiss in mine office, awakens me with this unwonted puttingon methinks strangely, for he hath not used it before.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Pray you, lets hear.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: [Reads] Whatsoever you may hear to the contrary, let Claudio be executed by four of the clock and in the afternoon Barnardine: for my better satisfaction, let me have Claudios head sent me by five. Let this be duly performed with a thought that more depends on it than we must yet deliver. Thus fail not to do your office, as you will answer it at your peril. What say you to this, sir

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: What is that Barnardine who is to be executed in the afternoon

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: A Bohemian born, but here nursed un and bred one that is a prisoner nine years old.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: How came it that the absent duke had not either delivered him to his liberty or executed him I have heard it was ever his manner to do so.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: His friends still wrought reprieves for him: and, indeed, his fact, till now in the government of Lord Angelo, came not to an undoubtful proof.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: It is now apparent

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Most manifest, and not denied by himself.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Hath he born himself penitently in prison how seems he to be touched

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: A man that apprehends death no more dreadfully but as a drunken sleep careless, reckless, and fearless of whats past, present, or to come insensible of mortality, and desperately mortal.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: He wants advice.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: He will hear none: he hath evermore had the liberty of the prison give him leave to escape hence, he would not: drunk many times a day, if not many days entirely drunk. We have very oft awaked him, as if to carry him to execution, and showed him a seeming warrant for it: it hath not moved him at all.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: More of him anon. There is written in your brow, provost, honesty and constancy: if I read it not truly, my ancient skill beguiles me but, in the boldness of my cunning, I will lay myself in hazard. Claudio, whom here you have warrant to execute, is no greater forfeit to the law than Angelo who hath sentenced him. To make you understand this in a manifested effect, I crave but four days respite for the which you are to do me both a present and a dangerous courtesy.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Pray, sir, in what

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: In the delaying death.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: A lack, how may I do it, having the hour limited, and an express command, under penalty, to deliver his head in the view of Angelo I may make my case as Claudios, to cross this in the smallest.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: By the vow of mine order I warrant you, if my instructions may be your guide. Let this Barnardine be this morning executed, and his head born to Angelo.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Angelo hath seen them both, and will discover the favour.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: O, deaths a great disguiser and you may add to it. Shave the head, and tie the beard and say it was the desire of the penitent to be so bared before his death: you know the course is common. If any thing fall to you upon this, more than thanks and good fortune, by the saint whom I profess, I will plead against it with my life.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Pardon me, good father it is against my oath.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Were you sworn to the duke, or to the deputy

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: To him, and to his substitutes.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: You will think you have made no offence, if the duke avouch the justice of your dealing

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: But what likelihood is in that

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: Not a resemblance, but a certainty. Yet since I see you fearful, that neither my coat, integrity, nor persuasion can with ease attempt you, I will go further than I meant, to pluck all fears out of you. Look you, sir, here is the hand and seal of the duke: you know the character, I doubt not and the signet is not strange to you.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I know them both.

lines.speaker: duke vincentio
lines.text: The contents of this is the return of the duke: you shall anon overread it at your pleasure where you shall find, within these two days he will be here. This is a thing that Angelo knows not for he this very day receives letters of strange tenor perchance of the dukes death perchance entering into some monastery but, by chance, nothing of what is writ. Look, the unfolding star calls up the shepherd. Put not yourself into amazement how these things should be: all difficulties are but easy when they are known. Call your executioner, and off with Barnardines head: I will give him a present shrift and advise him for a better place. Yet you are amazed but this shall absolutely resolve you. Come away it is almost clear dawn.
Exeunt
